meanings.definition: In a manner that conveys high status or honor.
meanings.sent1: She walked prestigiously into the room, commanding attention.
meanings.sent2: The queen waved prestigiously to her subjects from the balcony.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat prestigiously on top of the refrigerator, surveying its kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood prestigiously in the center of the garden, a symbol of strength and endurance.
meanings.sent5: The actor carried himself prestigiously on stage, earning the admiration of the audience.

meanings.sent1: The students listened prestigiously to their teacher, eager to learn.
meanings.sent2: The crowd clapped prestigiously after the moving performance.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail prestigiously when praised for fetching the ball.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak rose prestigiously above the clouds, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was displayed prestigiously in the gallery, attracting many visitors.

meanings.definition: In a way that is esteemed or respected by others.
meanings.sent1: The scientist spoke prestigiously about the groundbreaking discovery.
meanings.sent2: The author's books are sold prestigiously in bookstores around the world.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to cook prestigiously in her toy kitchen, mimicking her mom.
meanings.sent4: The historic building stood prestigiously in the town square, a symbol of the past.
meanings.sent5: The athlete performed prestigiously in the championship game, earning the admiration of fans.
